intro: Maesa arabica, commonly known as the Arabian maesa, is a flowering plant native to the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with dense, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in rocky or coastal areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
